About LTE Profiles

4G is the fourth generation of cellular network technology that succeeds 3G capabilities and provides connectivity to most current Long-Term Evolution (LTE) cellphones.

A 4G radio profile contains a grouping of parameters that form a basis for configuring or modifying a 4G device. The configuration or modification of a 4G device can only be accomplished by configuring or modifying a 4G profile. When any changes are made and saved, these changes are automatically applied to all the associated devices in the PW EMS database. The PW EMS has several default 4G profile templates that can be used. Each profile template contains pre-defined parameters that can be assigned and applied to one or more connected vBBUs on the service provider network. Also, an LTE profile can be built from the beginning (greenfield) for your service provider network. Refer to the following sections for more information about using default and created LTE profiles in your environment.

Parent topic: Create Device Profiles
